metadata.title: How to Start a YouTube Podcast 2025: Complete Setup Guide
metadata.description: Launch a video podcast on YouTube. Equipment, software, format, and growth strategies for podcast creators.

hero.headline: How to Start a YouTube Podcast
hero.subheadline: Video podcasts are exploding. Here's everything you need to launch yours.

sections.content: Video podcasts on YouTube are growing faster than audio-only. You get the discoverability of YouTube plus the deep engagement of long-form conversation. Many successful podcasts started on YouTube before expanding to Spotify and Apple. Here's how to launch your video podcast.

content.title: Quality Microphones
content.description: Shure SM7B or Rode PodMic for each host. Audio quality is non-negotiable.

content.title: Multi-Camera Setup
content.description: At least 2-3 cameras for visual variety. Switch between wide and close-ups.

content.title: Audio Interface
content.description: Rodecaster Pro II or Focusrite for multiple mic inputs and easy control.

content.title: OBS Studio
content.description: Free multi-camera recording and scene switching. Industry standard.

content.title: Riverside or Squadcast
content.description: High-quality remote guest recording. Essential for remote interviews.

content.title: DaVinci Resolve
content.description: Multicam editing with audio sync. Free version handles podcast editing.

sections.title: Podcast Launch Checklist
content: Set up recording space with acoustic treatment
Test audio levels and video quality
Create podcast artwork and channel art

sections.title: Video Podcast Best Practices
content: Use multiple camera angles for visual interest
Add B-roll and graphics in post
Create clips for Shorts and TikTok

sections.title: Per-Episode Workflow
content: Edit for pacing and remove dead air

faq.question: How long should podcast episodes be?
faq.answer: 1-2 hours is standard for deep conversation. But edit ruthlesslyâ€”keep the best parts. Some successful podcasts are 30-45 minutes.

faq.question: Do I need a co-host?
faq.answer: Not required. Solo podcasts work (monologues, interviews). Co-hosts add dynamics but complicate scheduling. Start with what's sustainable.

faq.question: Should I record video and audio separately?
faq.answer: Yes. Always record backup audio through your interface. Video can fail. Audio backup saves episodes.

faq.question: How do I get guests?
faq.answer: Start with your network. Reach out to bigger guests as you grow. Having 10-20 episodes builds credibility. Warm intros work best.
